title: Symmetric product (topology)
summary: In algebraic topology, the nth symmetric product of a topological space consists of the unordered n-tuples of its elements. If one fixes a  basepoint, there is a canonical way of embedding the lower-dimensional symmetric products into the higher-dimensional ones. That way, one can consider the colimit over the symmetric products, the infinite symmetric product. This construction can easily be extended to give a homotopy functor.
